title: Motivation. Groups as metric spaces
speaker: Sergio Romero Alba
series: Topological and Homological Tools for the Study of Spaces from Infinitely Far Away
description: This course provides an illustrative introduction to coarse geometry and progresses toward presenting currently open research problems related to the computation of large scale invariants, particularly through the framework of topological bornological spaces. From Coarse Geometry to Cohomology and Stone Spaces.
abstract: We review, through examples, the foundational philosophy of Geometric Group Theory, where each group G with a finite generating set S is associated with a metric space (G, dS), translating algebraic properties of the group into geometric features of the space. Although this assignment initially depends on the choice of S, such dependence vanishes when viewing (G, dS) "from infinitely far away". This motivates the introduction of coarse structures.
about: Sergio Romero Alba is affiliated with Georg-August-Universität Göttingen and University of Málaga. His research focuses on coarse geometry, homological algebra, and the study of spaces from infinitely far away using topological and homological tools. He works on coarse cohomology and its applications to geometric group theory and topological bornological spaces.

title: Coarse cohomology and the coarse category. Basic properties
speaker: Sergio Romero Alba
series: Topological and Homological Tools for the Study of Spaces from Infinitely Far Away
description: This course provides an illustrative introduction to coarse geometry and progresses toward presenting currently open research problems related to the computation of large scale invariants, particularly through the framework of topological bornological spaces. From Coarse Geometry to Cohomology and Stone Spaces.
abstract: The coarse cohomology HX*(X) of a space X is introduced as a functor from the coarse category, and its coarse invariance is discussed. We then particularize to metric spaces and study a few examples.

title: Ideals of contractible DGAs. The Roe product in coarse cohomology
speaker: Sergio Romero Alba
series: Topological and Homological Tools for the Study of Spaces from Infinitely Far Away
description: This course provides an illustrative introduction to coarse geometry and progresses toward presenting currently open research problems related to the computation of large scale invariants, particularly through the framework of topological bornological spaces. From Coarse Geometry to Cohomology and Stone Spaces.
abstract: We refine the structure of HX*(X), enhancing it to an algebra by endowing it with a product. Much like the cup product allows for a finer distinction between topological spaces, it is natural to seek products in coarse cohomology that sharpen the information it provides. We will introduce the Roe product in coarse cohomology.

title: Topological bornological spaces and their cohomology
speaker: Sergio Romero Alba
series: Topological and Homological Tools for the Study of Spaces from Infinitely Far Away
description: This course provides an illustrative introduction to coarse geometry and progresses toward presenting currently open research problems related to the computation of large scale invariants, particularly through the framework of topological bornological spaces. From Coarse Geometry to Cohomology and Stone Spaces.
abstract: The category TopBorn of topological bornological spaces is defined. We propose an invariant HB* on these spaces, which we call bornological cohomology, and show that it can be determined from the Alexander–Spanier cohomology at infinity. We compute several examples and enrich HB* with a product.

title: Low degree cohomology, extension spaces and boundaries at infinity. Open problems
speaker: Sergio Romero Alba
series: Topological and Homological Tools for the Study of Spaces from Infinitely Far Away
description: This course provides an illustrative introduction to coarse geometry and progresses toward presenting currently open research problems related to the computation of large scale invariants, particularly through the framework of topological bornological spaces. From Coarse Geometry to Cohomology and Stone Spaces.
abstract: We ask whether, for a topological bornological space X, there exists a connection between HB1(X) and the "components at infinity of X". This leads us to consider rays in X, connected components at infinity, and compactifications of X. We study extensions whose boundaries at infinity are Stone spaces and conclude with open research questions.
